entry.title: RAP I_SalesOrderTP lock error on Update
entry.content:
Hello,

in a RAP behavior determination I'm trying to modify the scheduling line of an sales order item:

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_salesordertp

    ENTITY SalesOrderScheduleLine

      UPDATE FROM VALUE #( for k in dlv(

         SalesOrder = k-SalesOrder

        SalesOrderItem = k-SalesOrderItem

      SchedulineLine   = k-SalesOrderSchedLIne

     RequestedDeliveryDate = k-DeliveryDate

   %control-RequestedDeliveryDate = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ))

    FAILED data(ls_failed)

For a single entry it works but if I have more than one entry in table dlv I got an an error in table ls_failed for each entry like the following:

I replicate the same code in an abap program ( SE38 ). I got the same problem. If I split the modifications using multiple modify statement and put a commit entities between each modify it works correctly.

Any suggestions ?

entry.title: Re: Future of Feature Toggles
entry.content:
Unfortunately, in 2025, I don't see any future for custom usage, but maybe later... : Solved: Unable to create "Switch-Based Feature Toggles" - SAP Community

Transaction FTGL is read-only.

Switch-Based Feature Toggles are read-only (dixit Feature Toggle Editor | SAP Help Portal).

Workaround: you may use the Switch Framework instead, though it may look overcomplicated for features of few lines of code.

NB: CL_FEATURE_TOGGLE (belongs to FTGL) still exists in ABAP 7.58 - S/4HANA 2023 FPS 01 ON-PREMISE.

entry.title: SAM DM Pod execution plugin to do a HTTP POST operation to S/4HANA Cloud api
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have built a POD synchronous  execution plugin based on the sample available in dm-podplugin-extensions/ExtensionPodPluginTemplate_and_Example at https://github.com/SAP-samples/digital-manufacturing-extension-samples and cannot do a POST call to an S/4HANA cloud ODATA api .

execute: function () {

            if (this.getPodSelectionModel().getOperation() && this.getPodSelectionModel().getOperation().routing) {
                console.log("Order ID in process is : ", this.podSelectionModel.getOperation().routing);
                let sOrder = this.podSelectionModel.getOperation().routing;
                let self = this;
                return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {

                    let oDataModel = new ODataModel({
                        "serviceUrl": "https://" + window.location.host + "/destination/S4-Dev-Label-api/",
                        "earlyRequests": true,
                        "operationMode": "Server",
                        "groupId": "$direct",
                        "synchronizationMode": "None",
                        "odataVersion": "4.0"
                    });
                    let oView = self.getPodController().getView();
                    oView.setModel(oDataModel, "pluginExtModel");
                    oView.bindElement({ path: "/ZC_PROD_LABEL('" + sOrder + "')", model: "pluginExtModel" });
                    var oBindingContext = oView.getBindingContext("pluginExtModel");
                    
                    let oActionODataContextBinding = oView.getModel("pluginExtModel").bindContext("com.sap.gateway.srvd_a2x.zser_mfg_label.v0001.printForm(...)", oBindingContext);
                    
                    oActionODataContextBinding.invoke()
                        .then(() => {
                            const oActionContext = oActionODataContextBinding.getBoundContext();
                            console.log(oActionContext.getObject());
                            MessageToast.show("Submitted to S/4HANA Print queue!");
                            resolve();
                        },
                            (oError) => {
                                MessageBox.alert(oError.message, {
                                    icon: MessageBox.Icon.ERROR,
                                    title: "Error"
                                });
                                console.log(oError.message);
                                resolve();
                            });
                });


            } else {
                MessageBox.error("Please select an Order first.");
            }

            return true;
        },

 The destination is configured in BTP cockpit subaccount where DMC subscription is.

The plugin is assigned to an action button and when the call is happening, in the network tab of developer's console, I can see the CSRF token is passed in the request header but it is not valid for the S/4HANA backend. It seems the CSRF token is issued from the BTP destination itself but not the backend.

I also tried with adding the destination in the managed destination service instance  created after deployment of the plugin to cloud foundry:

Added the following the app router xsapp.json with csrfProtection as false to allow for the backend to issue the token instead of the destination itself:

{
  "welcomeFile": "/podplugins/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "none",
  "logout": {
    "logoutEndpoint": "/do/logout"
  },
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/podplugins/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "localDir": "webapp"
    },
    {
      "source": "https://<my-dmc-host-url>/destination/S4-Dev-Label-api/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "SAP_API",
      "authenticationType": "XSUAA",
      "csrfProtection": false
    }
  ]
}

But above change in approuter fails when deploying it to CF.

Error starting application "udhgdmc-executionplugin": Some instances have crashed. Check the logs of your application for more information.
Download the application logs via the dmol command and check them for more information.
A step of the process has failed. Retrying it may solve the issue.
Process failed.
Use "cf deploy -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9 -a abort" to abort the process.
Use "cf deploy -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9 -a retry" to retry the process.
Use "cf dmol -i a49c75d8-ab91-11f0-9368-eeee0a87f9d9" to download the logs of the process.
Exit error code: 1

I checked this documentation and it says need to fetch x-csrf-token for POST calls. Does this mean that I need to implement REST api call in javascript and not using ODatamodel as I did here?

 @tobias_renth  @Kevin_Hunter1 @ManoelCosta 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Re: SAP Crystal Reports for Visual Studio SP37 print some...
entry.content:
Wow, I've never seen that happen before, it's not just the whole number but each part separated by the comma....

See if SP 38 fixes the issue:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

Try exporting to PDF and see if fixes the issue?

I tried downloading that driver for Windows 11 and it's not listed.

Do you know if there is a PCL or PS driver for that printer?

See if one of those will work for you.

Old HP drivers caused all sorts of issues with CR, nothing CR could do, HP had to fix them....

The odd thing is CR formats the report and then generates an EPF file to send to the printer, it's an image of the page...

Do you have a full version of CR Designer or are you using the Embedded Report Designer in VS to preview the report?

So that suggests it is CR formatting the number. Try setting your number delimiter to Canada, it uses a period as the decimal point. 

It could be  the comma is causing CR to format the number.

What version of Windows are you using?

weird one....

entry.title: SAP Business Network Continues to Receive Top Accolades From Peer Reviews
entry.content:
SAP is excited to share that its B2B trading partner platform, SAP Business Network, has received significant recognition from two leading peer review firms—TrustRadius and G2.

For the second year in a row, SAP Business Network has received a Top Rated award from TrustRadius in the Supply Chain Visibility software category. This recognition is due to the satisfaction that SAP customers have experienced with SAP Business Network, and their willingness to share their views publicly.

According to TrustRadius, the awards are based entirely on customer feedback, received, scored, and verified by the platform. TrustRadius describes the Supply Chain Visibility category as software that “tracks the production and shipment of assets between suppliers, manufacturers, retailers, distributors, and customers from a centralized platform. Supply Chain Visibility software offers tracking, analytics, and reporting on products, orders, and raw materials.”   

"SAP Business Network earning a TrustRadius Top Rated award highlights its impact in streamlining and strengthening global supply chain collaboration,” said Allyson Havener, Chief Marketing Officer at TrustRadius. “Within their reviews, customers consistently call out the platform for increasing transparency, improving partner connectivity, and driving operational efficiency.”

Through SAP’s partnership with TrustRadius, prospective customers have been able to obtain first-hand feedback from SAP Business Network customers with respect to their satisfaction with their deployments, product functionality, and business outcomes. Product reviews and ratings provide an objective viewpoint, as well as valuable product, feature, and benefit information about the SAP Business Network solution portfolio.

For example, in one review, the general manager in research and development at a large pharmaceuticals company referred to SAP Business Network as “a powerful platform that enhances collaboration and efficiency across various functions in the pharmaceutical industry.” Similarly, an engineer in a small engineering firm considers SAP Business Network to be one of the best tools to build a stronger supply chain network and “deliver on the end user promise…closing the gaps between trading partners, enabling transaction exchange, information sharing, and partner discovery.”

The SAP Business Network Market Report, developed in collaboration with TrustRadius, summarizes customer sentiment from the ratings:

  • 97% of reviewers would buy SAP Business Network again
  • 85% are satisfied with its feature set
  • 89% believe it delivers good value for the price
  • Usability Rating: 8.7/10
  • Likelihood to Recommend: 8.6/10

In addition to the recognition provided by TrustRadius, SAP Business Network has also been designated as both a Leader and a Momentum Leader by G2 in the Supply Chain Business Networks category. According to G2, products in the Leader quadrant, as defined by G2, are rated highly by G2 users and have substantial Market Presence scores. This award confirms that SAP Business Network maintains its leadership amongst our peers, as well as continues to build momentum in the marketplace, according to G2’s algorithms and comprehensive evaluation, together with verified customer reviews. Customers reviewing SAP Business Network on G2 have referred to the solution as a “game-changer,” “hassle-free,” and “a large network which can be trusted and work efficiently in the large scale.”

G2 defines the Supply Chain Business Networks category as follows:

Supply Chain Business Network software helps businesses create efficient supply chain ecosystems. These solutions offer tools to find, compare, and evaluate suitable suppliers, distributors, or manufacturers to support a company’s supply chain needs. To qualify for inclusion in the Supply Chain Business Networks category, a product must:

 - Provide a platform to search and develop supply chain business relations 
 - Connect businesses with various suppliers across the globe
 - Allow visibility to compare supplier orders and quotes
 - Provide software tools to help manage a supply chain end-to-end

The SAP Business Network team deeply appreciates the trust that our customers have placed in us. For more information about SAP Business Network visit us online. In addition, to learn more about how SAP Business Network can provide value for your organization, try our online business value calculator, developed in collaboration with IDC.*

* Developed by IDC, sponsored by SAP

entry.title: Re: Project: Budget Availability Control: message has nam...
entry.content:
Good day @Lut_De_Meyer34 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Budget Availability Control for Projects, Situation Handling, Manage Situation Types - Extended

From reactive to proactive: Use extended situation handling for enterprise projects

To summarise, the message about the Budget tolerance limit been reached is static and does not dynamically insert the project Manager’s name from the project master data. The clean-core design in public cloud is the reason why the dynamic substitution used in classic PS (CJ32) is not active. The Project Manager field can be maintained in the project master but it will not populate the message automatically.

Instead, SAP recommends implementing situation handling for project budget monitoring, which will automatically notify the responsible project manager when a defined tolerance is reached.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: State of entity CDS~A_HANDLINGUNIT_2 with key was alr...
entry.content:
Good day @as5 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Operations for Handling Unit API, Extending the Integration APIs

How to use etag for change operations in S/4HANA OData APIs

In summary, the error you received occurs because your PATCH request uses a stale or missing ETag header. In public cloud, all OData APIs (including the handling unit API) use ETag-based concurrency control to prevent conflicting updates. You can solve it by:

  • Executing a GET request first to retrieve the latest entity and its ETag.
  • Then include the exact if-match header with that ETag in your PATCH request.
  • Alternatively, you can use if-match to override concurrency protection (not recommended for parallel processes).
  • Ensure your custom field YY1_CarrierTracking_HUH is published, visible in the metadata, and updatable.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: manager user not shown
entry.content:
Hi dear community,

We’ve moved a client’s SAP Business One database from a cloud environment to an on-premise server. After restoring the database, the default manager user does not show up under Administration → Setup → General → Users. My understanding is that manager is created automatically when a new company DB is initialized.

I’d appreciate help with the following:

  • Is it safe/best practice to recreate the manager user on the restored on-premise database so it behaves like the original?

  • Is there a known reason why manager may be hidden/disabled or absent in SAP B1 Cloud deployments?

  • For licensing/concurrency: on the on-premise server, two distinct users can log in to the SAP B1 Desktop Client simultaneously from different machines. Does the presence/absence of manager impact this in any way?

Any insights or steps to properly restore or replace manager would be very helpful. Thank you!
SAP Business One, version for SAP HANA @Darius @richardduffy

entry.title: ABAP code to transport many packages in one transport request
entry.content:
I have created this program in a system with ABAP 7.58 to transport the objects from many packages + include objects from additional transport requests.

For one or few packages, it's best to transport manually via official SE80 > Select package > Context menu "Write transport request".

It was developed quick & dirty.

It's not using any official API, so use it at your own risk.

The only screen:

For information, this program relies on the code triggered via SE80 for one package:

Happy transport!

Sandra

Here is the code. I have indicated from which subroutines I have copied the code.

 

REPORT z_transport_many_packages.

DATA gv_devclass TYPE tadir-devclass.
DATA gv_trkorr   TYPE e070-trkorr.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK source WITH FRAME TITLE text_001.
  SELECT-OPTIONS s_devcla FOR gv_devclass.
  SELECT-OPTIONS s_trkorr FOR gv_trkorr.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK source.

SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK target WITH FRAME TITLE text_002.
  PARAMETERS p_trkorr TYPE trkorr.
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK target.

INITIALIZATION.
  text_001 = 'Source'(001).
  text_002 = 'Target'(002).
  %_S_DEVCLA_%_APP_%-TEXT = 'Packages to transport'(003).
  %_S_TRKORR_%_APP_%-TEXT = 'TRs to include in transport'(004).
  %_P_TRKORR_%_APP_%-TEXT = 'Target Transport Request'(005).

START-OF-SELECTION.
  IF s_devcla IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT devclass
      FROM tdevc
      WHERE devclass IN @s_devcla
      INTO TABLE @DATA(gt_tdevc).
  ENDIF.

  IF s_trkorr IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT trkorr
      FROM e070
      WHERE trkorr IN @s_trkorr
      INTO TABLE @DATA(gt_e070).
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT gt_tdevc REFERENCE INTO DATA(ls_tdevc).

    " Code from subroutine TRANSPORT_DEVCLASS_OBJECTS of program SAPLSEAP
    " (called by subroutine TRANSPORT_OBJECT_PART_2 of program SAPLSEAP,
    "  itself called by subroutine TRANSPORT_OBJECT_PART_1 of program SAPLSEAP)
    DATA(l_tadir_objs) = VALUE scts_tadir( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'TRINT_SELECT_OBJECTS'
      EXPORTING  iv_devclass              = ls_tdevc->devclass
                 iv_only_existing_objects = abap_false
                 iv_via_selscreen         = abap_false
      IMPORTING
                 et_objects_tadir         = l_tadir_objs
      EXCEPTIONS cancelled_by_user        = 1
                 invalid_input            = 2
                 OTHERS                   = 3.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE 'Error in TRINT_SELECT_OBJECTS' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
      STOP.
    ENDIF.
    DATA l_e071_obj TYPE trwbo_s_e071.
    DATA l_ddlname  TYPE ddlname.
    DATA l_objects  TYPE trwbo_t_e071.
    LOOP AT l_tadir_objs ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<l_tadir_obj>) WHERE object <> 'STOB'.
      IF <l_tadir_obj>-object = 'VIEW'.
        CLEAR l_ddlname.
        PERFORM get_ddl_source USING    <l_tadir_obj>-obj_name
                               CHANGING l_ddlname.
        IF l_ddlname IS NOT INITIAL.
          CONTINUE.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.

      l_e071_obj-pgmid    = <l_tadir_obj>-pgmid.
      l_e071_obj-object   = <l_tadir_obj>-object.
      l_e071_obj-obj_name = <l_tadir_obj>-obj_name.
      APPEND l_e071_obj TO l_objects.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDLOOP.

  " Code from TRANSPORT_OBJECT_PART_1
  IF l_objects IS NOT INITIAL.
    DATA l_suppress_dialog TYPE trparflag VALUE space.
    DATA l_es_request      TYPE trwbo_request_header.

    IF p_trkorr IS NOT INITIAL.
      l_suppress_dialog = 'X'.
    ENDIF.
    CALL FUNCTION 'TR_REQUEST_CHOICE'
      EXPORTING
                 iv_suppress_dialog   = l_suppress_dialog
                 it_e071              = l_objects
                 iv_request           = p_trkorr
      IMPORTING
                 es_request           = l_es_request
      EXCEPTIONS
                 invalid_request      = 1
                 invalid_request_type = 2
                 user_not_owner       = 3
                 no_objects_appended  = 4
                 enqueue_error        = 5
                 cancelled_by_user    = 6
                 recursive_call       = 7
                 OTHERS               = 8.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      p_trkorr = l_es_request-trkorr.
      IF l_suppress_dialog IS NOT INITIAL.
        MESSAGE s033(to) WITH l_es_request-trkorr.
      ENDIF.
    ELSE.
      IF p_trkorr IS NOT INITIAL.
        " do it again with dialog enabled:
        CALL FUNCTION 'TR_REQUEST_CHOICE'
          EXPORTING
                     it_e071              = l_objects
                     iv_request           = p_trkorr
          IMPORTING
                     es_request           = l_es_request
          EXCEPTIONS
                     invalid_request      = 1
                     invalid_request_type = 2
                     user_not_owner       = 3
                     no_objects_appended  = 4
                     enqueue_error        = 5
                     cancelled_by_user    = 6
                     recursive_call       = 7
                     OTHERS               = 8.
      ENDIF.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        p_trkorr = l_es_request-trkorr.
        MESSAGE s033(to) WITH l_es_request-trkorr.
      ELSE.
        MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE 'S' NUMBER sy-msgno
                WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
        STOP.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE s604(eu).
  ENDIF.

  " Subroutine COPY_OBJECT_LIST of program SAPLSTRH
  LOOP AT gt_e070 REFERENCE INTO DATA(ls_e070).
    CALL FUNCTION 'TR_COPY_COMM'
      EXPORTING  wi_dialog                = 'X'
                 wi_trkorr_from           = ls_e070->trkorr
                 wi_trkorr_to             = p_trkorr
                 wi_without_documentation = abap_false
      EXCEPTIONS OTHERS                   = 1.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE 'Error in TR_COPY_COMM' TYPE 'S' DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
      STOP.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.

  COMMIT WORK.

FORM get_ddl_source USING    p_viewname TYPE csequence
                    CHANGING p_ddlname  TYPE ddlname.

  DATA handler TYPE REF TO if_dd_ddl_handler.

  TRY.
      handler = cl_dd_ddl_handler_factory=>create( ).
      p_ddlname = handler->get_ddl_name_4_dd_artefact( CONV ddobjname( p_viewname ) ).
    CATCH cx_dd_ddl_exception ##NO_HANDLER.
  ENDTRY.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Difference between freight charges and landed costs during purchase
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please explain the difference between freight charges and landed costs? I’ve noticed that SAP provides separate screens for both, even though they are both additional costs incurred during the purchasing process and can be capitalized into inventory, thereby increasing the item cost.

For freight charges, there’s an option to decide whether or not to include the freight in the item cost by using the “Fixed Asset/Stock” checkbox. My understanding is that if the “Stock” checkbox is selected, the freight amount should be capitalized — meaning it will be added to the item cost and not immediately posted to an expense account. The expense will then be recognized later when the item is issued or sold. If the “Stock” checkbox is unchecked, the freight charges are posted directly to an expense account without affecting the item cost.

I created one freight line with the “Stock” checkbox checked. However, when I added a GRPO, the system gave me an error saying that certain G/L accounts were not defined. I was under the impression that when the “Stock” checkbox is selected, there’s no need to book any expense because the freight is capitalized. But I noticed that it only works if I define an expense clearing account, and in that case, the system posts a credit to that expense clearing account. This is confusing to me — if the cost is capitalized, why does it still need to post to an expense clearing account?

Is my understanding correct so far? And how does this behavior differ from how landed costs work in SAP?

Hello @Shyam4U 

You're correct regarding the BTP trial/subscription: those tiles won’t appear in the cockpit, as SAP_BR_DEVELOPER isn’t displayed there. The solution is to activate the RAP service binding and assign the generated IAM catalogue to the user within the ABAP system’s Fiori Launchpad. SAP Help Portal-SAP Fiori Applications in the ABAP Environment

ABAP Environment, Business Catalogues and Business Roles where app access actually originates from in ABAP Env FLP.

Below are some useful SAP Documentation related

Maintain Business Roles & Users (FLP) and confirm that you do this inside the ABAP system’s Fiori Launchpad, not in the BTP cockpit. SAP Help Portal

Web Access for ABAP (subscription on trial), how do you get browser access to the ABAP FLP to assign roles? SAP Help Portal

ABAP Env Authorisation Model tutorial, hands-on guide to IAM in ABAP Environment (roles, catalogues, app exposure). SAP

RAP security – how RAP enforces authorisations (DCL/authorisation checks) once the user has the right role. SAP

BAS → ABAP destination (OAuth2 User Token Exchange), required so preview carries the user context/authorisations to ABAP. SAP Help Portal

 Context clarifier S/4HANA Cloud SAP_BR_DEVELOPER resides in S/4HANA Cloud dev tenants, not in BTP cockpit role collections. This is helpful when someone searches for it in the wrong place. SAP Help Portal

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Why does compare quotation screen not show payment te...
entry.content:
SAP Public Cloud emphasizes clean, role-based interfaces. The “Compare Supplier Quotations” app focuses on price, delivery date, and quantity—core metrics for automated decision-making. Payment Terms Are Considered Separately: SAP assumes that payment terms are part of the supplier master data or RFQ header and are reviewed during final selection, not during initial comparison. No Custom Fields in Standard Comparison: Unlike on-premise, Public Cloud restricts field-level extensibility in some apps, including quotation comparison. This means you can’t easily add payment terms to the comparison screen without using developer extensibility.

Some workarounds are

Use the “Manage RFQs” App. This app shows payment terms at the RFQ level. You can manually compare quotations by opening each RFQ and reviewing the payment terms.

From the “Compare Supplier Quotations” app, export the data and manually add payment terms from RFQ headers. This is a common workaround used by procurement teams.

If you have developer extensibility enabled, create a custom CDS view that joins RFQ header (including payment terms) / Quotation items. Then build a custom report or Fiori app to compare quotations with payment terms included.

entry.title: Re: How to update “Display-only” material master fields (...
entry.content:
No, SAP does not support updating display-only fields like MARA-BRGEW and MARA-NTGEW via MM17 or MATMAS IDoc unless their field selection status is changed to allow input. This restriction applies even in S/4HANA.

Why you can’t update display-only fields via MM17 or IDoc is because, Field Selection Controls in OMS9/OMS2 settings define whether a field is optional, mandatory, or display-only across transactions like MM02, MM17, and IDoc processing. SAP treats display-only fields as non-dialog, meaning they are excluded from update logic—even if technically present in the IDoc or MM17 structure. The error message MG140 confirms that the field is locked for input and cannot be updated programmatically unless its status is changed.

Some workarounds are

Use transaction OMS9 to change the field selection group for BRGEW and NTGEW to “optional” or “required.” This allows MM17 or MATMAS IDoc to update the fields. After the update, revert the field status to “display” if needed for business control.

You can use BAPI_MATERIAL_SAVEDATA to update these fields, but only if field selection allows input. Include the values in the UNITSOFMEASURE structure and ensure the field selection permits updates.

entry.title: Re: convert customer and vendor with different account gr...
entry.content:
Yes, the CVI_LEDH (Customer-Vendor Integration Leading Object Handling) functionality does work even when the customer and vendor belong to different account groups, but with important considerations.

When you choose a leading object (either customer or vendor), the system uses its data as the primary source when creating the Business Partner (BP).

The account group defines field control, number range, and other master data attributes. If the customer and vendor have different account groups, SAP will use the leading object’s account group to determine which fields are mandatory or optional. Attempt to merge data from both objects, but prioritize the leading object for conflicting fields.

Some key considerations are

If a field is mandatory in one account group but optional in the other, the leading object’s rules apply. Conflicts in field values (e.g., industry, reconciliation account) may require manual resolution.

If the customer and vendor use different number ranges, the BP creation will follow the leading object’s number range logic. Ensure that the BP grouping is compatible with both account groups.

The CVI framework assumes that customer and vendor data can be harmonized into a single BP. If the account groups are too divergent (e.g., one is for domestic and one for foreign entities), you may need to adjust field mappings or use separate BPs.

Finally, before merging, run the CVI_PRECHK report to simulate and validate the merge. It will highlight any inconsistencies or mandatory field issues due to account group differences.

entry.title: Re: How to make MRP Strategy 10 ignore special procuremen...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, MRP Strategy 10 does not inherently ignore inter-plant demand like stock transport orders or purchase requisitions. To prevent these from influencing the supplying plant’s MRP, you must adjust the special procurement settings or use a workaround to isolate independent requirements.

Why Inter-Plant demand affects MRP Strategy 10 is because, MRP Strategy 10 (Net Requirements Planning) is designed to plan based on planned independent requirements (PIRs) only, ignoring sales orders. However, inter-plant purchase requisitions are treated as dependent requirements, and SAP MRP includes them in the net requirements calculation—even under Strategy 10. This behavior is standard in Public Cloud and differs from on-premise flexibility.

Explore the below options

Create a separate MRP area for the supplying plant that excludes inter-plant demand. Assign PIRs to this MRP area and run MRP only for it. This isolates the independent requirements from external demands.

In the material master (MRP 2 view), check the special procurement type. If set to “inter-plant stock transfer,” SAP will always consider external demand. You may need to remove or adjust this setting to prevent automatic inclusion.

Use planning segment filters to restrict which requirements are considered during MRP. This may require developer extensibility or configuration via SSCUI.

Maintain PIRs manually in the supplying plant and avoid automatic transfer of demand. Use MD61 or Fiori equivalent to enter PIRs and run MRP only on those.

entry.title: Re: Assignment of profitability segment in cross-company...
entry.content:
The error “Field BSEG-XYZ is not available in Dynpro SAPMF05A 0300” typically occurs because the custom CO-PA characteristic (XYZ) is not properly integrated into the screen structure used during IDoc posting. This is often due to missing configuration in the CO-PA field catalog or screen enhancement logic.

The root cause could be SAPMF05A 0300 is the screen used for financial document posting like FB01 or FB60. BSEG-XYZ refers to a custom CO-PA field added to the BSEG structure via enhancement. During IDoc inbound processing (e.g., via message type INVOIC), SAP tries to populate this field but fails because the field is not part of the screen structure, The field is not activated in the CO-PA field catalog and the field status group does not allow input for this field.

To fix this, go to transaction KEA5 and verify that your custom characteristic is Active, Assigned to the correct operating concern and marked for input in the relevant value fields

Use transaction SE51 or SE80 to check if the field BSEG-XYZ is included in the screen layout. If not, you may need to enhance the screen via user exit or BAdI BADI_FDCB_SUBBAS01 or BADI_ACC_DOCUMENT to populate CO-PA fields during posting. Ensure your enhancement includes logic to fill the custom field during IDoc processing.

Go to transaction OB41 to check the posting key field status. Go to transaction FS00 to check the G/L account field status group. Make sure the field is not suppressed or hidden.

In transaction VOFC, ensure that the account determination and profitability segment derivation are correctly set up. Use transaction KE4W to verify the derivation rules for PAOBJNR.

Check the IDoc structure (e.g., INVOIC02) and ensure that the custom field is mapped correctly. Use WE30/WE31 to verify the segment definitions. Use WE20 to check partner profile and processing settings.

entry.title: Re: Document type F ZPSO for qty.schedule not active Mess...
entry.content:
To resolve error message O1080 (“Document type F ZPSO for qty.schedule not active”) in ME21N, you need to activate the document type ZPSO for scheduling agreements in customizing under transaction SPRO.

Go to SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Scheduling Agreement → Define Document Types for Scheduling Agreements. Ensure that document type ZPSO is defined and active. Confirm that it is assigned to document category F (which stands for scheduling agreements)

In the same SPRO path, check the activation settings for quantity schedule. Make sure that ZPSO is flagged as active for quantity scheduling. This allows the system to process scheduling agreements with quantity schedules under this document type.

Use transaction SE16N to check entries in table T161. Look for document type ZPSO and confirm that the quantity schedule indicator is set correctly. If missing, update via SPRO or request a configuration transport.

Go to SPRO → Materials Management → Purchasing → Purchase Order → Define Screen Layout at Document Level. Ensure that the quantity schedule fields are not suppressed for document type ZPSO.

entry.title: Re: Guidance: creating 4 separate pricing procedures for...
entry.content:
SAP recommends separate pricing procedures for OR (Standard Sale), RE (Return), CR (Credit Memo Request), and DR (Debit Memo Request) only if the pricing logic differs significantly. Otherwise, minimizing the number of procedures is preferred for maintainability.

Use distinct pricing procedures if:

  • Pricing elements differ (e.g., RE needs negative signs, CR skips discounts).
  • Tax behavior varies (e.g., returns may need reversal tax logic).
  • Account determination or condition types change.
  • Copy control requires different pricing types (e.g., redetermine vs. copy unchanged).
  • Reporting or profitability analysis needs segmentation.

entry.title: Re: List of Forwarding agent and Names in SAP SD,LE (ECC)
entry.content:
Consider the below tables and table join to generate a report

Table: LFA1 (Vendor Master – General Data). Contains vendor codes and names. Field LIFNR: Vendor Number and Field NAME1: Vendor Name
Table: LFM1 (Vendor Master – Purchasing Data). Contains purchasing organization-specific data. Field SPART: Division and Field LOEVM: Deletion Indicator (blank = active)
Table: T024I (Shipping Instructions – Partner Function). Contains partner functions like forwarding agents. Field PARVW: Partner Function where select the custom Partner Function which would have been created for forwarding agent)
Table: KNVP (Customer Master Partner Functions) — if forwarding agents are maintained as customer partners.

entry.title: Re: Access Restriction based on maintenance order type
entry.content:
Yes, this requirement can be achieved using standard SAP S/4HANA (Private Cloud) without any customization by leveraging authorization objects and order type–specific configuration.

SAP uses the authorization object I_VORG_ORD to control access to maintenance orders. You can restrict access based on:

Order type (e.g., PM01 for corrective, PM02 for preventive)

Activity type (e.g., Create, Change, Display)

Ask your Security team to create two roles based on the above

  • Role A (Full Access). For PM01 (corrective) allow Create (IW31), Change (IW32), Display (IW33)
  • Role B (Display Only). For PM02 (preventive) allow only Display (IW33)

Combine both roles for the supervisor. SAP will enforce access based on order type and transaction.

entry.title: Re: supplier evaluation with scheduling agreements with n...
entry.content:
Yes, in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud, supplier evaluation can include scheduling agreements with an open-ended date (e.g., 9999), unlike ECC where only closed agreements were considered. This is part of the enhanced evaluation logic introduced in newer releases.

The key difference is in ECC, supplier evaluation logic excluded scheduling agreements with an end date of 9999 because they were considered open and not finalized. But in S/4HANA Private Cloud, especially from version 2022 onward, SAP enhanced the supplier evaluation apps to include open-ended scheduling agreements in performance calculations.

So what this means for you is you do not need to close or manually end scheduling agreements to have them considered in supplier evaluation. The system now evaluates based on actual delivery performance, quantity adherence, and timeliness, regardless of the end date. This allows ongoing agreements to contribute to KPIs like:

  • On-time delivery
  • Quantity reliability
  • Price adherence

entry.title: Sharing Data Products from SAP Databricks to SAP Business Data Cloud - Official Python SDK
entry.content:
This blog explains how to use Python SDK for publishing data products in SAP Business Data Cloud so that it becomes discoverable by other consumer applications in SAP Business Data Cloud, for example by SAP Datasphere.

Prerequisites - Adding Privileges into SAP Databricks

Steps to follow (Screenshots)

  1. Access your SAP Databricks Workspace environment. From the sidebar menu, choose Catalog.
  2. Choose the Manage (Gear icon) button and, from the dropdown menu, select Metastore.
  3. Choose the Permissions tab and then choose the Grant button.
  4. In the Principals field, enter the user or a group of users.
  5. Select the boxes CREATE CATALOG, CREATE SHARE, SET SHARE PERMISSION, USE PROVIDER, USE RECIPIENT, and USE SHARE then choose Confirm.
    You have added the necessary privileges.

Create a Delta Share

For a Delta Share to be exposed for downstream processing in SAP Databricks, it needs to be published as a data product with rich metadata. This can be done using an iPython Notebook available in your SAP Databricks Workspace. For further details on how to describe the data product, see Appendix A.

Steps to follow (Screenshots)

  1. Access your SAP Databricks Workspace environment.
  2. From the sidebar menu, choose Catalog.
  3. Choose the Manage (Gear icon) button and, from the dropdown menu, select Delta sharing.
  4. Under Share data, provide the following information:
    1. Create share: In the Share name field, enter a share name and choose Save and continue. The Description field is optional.
    2. Add data assets: Select one or more schemas, which includes all the tables in the schema, or one or more individual tables. Choose Save and continue.
    3. Add notebooks: (Optional) Specify the Storage location. Choose Save and continue.
    4. Add recipients: In the Recipient field, from the dropdown menu, select sap-business-data-cloud. Choose Share data.
  5. The Delta Share is now exposed to the workspace.

Publishing the Delta Share as Data Product to SAP Business Data Cloud

  1. Create a folder in the workspace by choosing Workspace  Create   Folder. Enter a name for this new folder and choose Create.
  2. Create a notebook, in the newly created folder, by selecting that folder and choosing Create  Notebook.
    Follow this steps from Learning Tutorial - https://learning.sap.com/courses/bt_bdc/dbx-enhance-data-product 
  3. Update the serverless environment version by following these steps:
    1. On the sidebar menu, choose the Environment button.
    2. In the Environment version field, use the dropdown menu to choose 3.
    3. Choose Apply.
  4. Hover over the area under the rectangle and use +Code to create a cell in the notebook to run the instructions.
  5. In this cell, install sap-bdc-connect-sdk:

Installation

To install this SDK use the following pip command:

pip install sap-bdc-connect-sdk

uv tool install sap-bdc-connect-sdk

Python Documentation for BDC Connect - https://pypi.org/project/sap-bdc-connect-sdk/ 

Create or update the share in sap-bdc-connect-sdk.

A share is a mechanism for distributing and accessing data across different systems. Creating or updating a share involves including specific attributes, such as @openResourceDiscoveryV1, in the request body, aligning with the Open Resource Discovery protocol. This procedure ensures that the share is properly structured and described according to specified standards, facilitating effective data sharing and management.

Copy the below code snippet and paste it to the cell, then provide the share-name, title, shortDescription and description of your share.

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "<recipient-name>"))

share_name = "<share-name>"

open_resource_discovery_information = {
    "@openResourceDiscoveryV1": {
        "title": "<title>",
        "shortDescription": "<short-description>",
        "description": "<description>"
    }
}

bdc_connect_client.create_or_update_share(
    share_name,
    open_resource_discovery_information
)

Create or update share CSN.

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.utils import csn_generator

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "<recipient-name>"))

share_name = "<share-name>"

csn_schema = csn_generator.generate_csn_template(share_name)

bdc_connect_client.create_or_update_share_csn(
    share_name,
    csn_schema
)

If the generated CSN needs to be modified for any reason, it can be written to a file for editing, for example.

			
from bdc_connect_sdk.utils import csn_generator
import json

share_name = "<share-name>"
csn_schema = csn_generator.generate_csn_template(share_name)

file_path = f"csn_{share_name}.json"
with open(file_path, "w") as csn_file:
    csn_file.write(json.dumps(csn_schema, indent=2))

# change the file

with open(file_path, "r") as csn_file:
    changed_csn_schema = csn_file.read()

csn_schema = changed_csn_schema

Publish the data product.

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "<recipient-name>"))

share_name = "<share-name>"

bdc_connect_client.publish_data_product(
    share_name
)

Unpublishing a Data Product

from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import BdcConnectClient
from bdc_connect_sdk.auth import DatabricksClient

bdc_connect_client = BdcConnectClient(DatabricksClient(dbutils, "<recipient-name>"))

share_name = "<share-name>"

bdc_connect_client.delete_share(
    share_name
)

 

Follow me for more updates - https://profile.sap.com/u/Yogananda

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 Release: What’s New & What Matters
entry.content:
SAP’s H2 2025 SuccessFactors release isn’t chasing headlines, it’s about foundation. After the wave of Joule and AI announcements earlier this year, this release focuses on what truly matters for customers and partners: consistency, data quality, and modernization.

What this really means is that SAP is tightening every bolt, from the redesigned People Profile to the smallest validation rule - to make sure SuccessFactors can handle the next phase of intelligent, connected HXM.

Key Themes in the 2H 2025 Release

1️⃣  Full Profile redesign everywhere

The editing and history experiences in the latest People Profile have been completely reimagined. Dependents, contact data, and emergency information now follow the same modern pattern - intuitive, streamlined, and consistent.

2️⃣ Cleaner data and smarter rules

Across Employee Central, Time, and Benefits, SAP introduced tighter validations, better error handling, and enhanced rule contexts. This ensures data accuracy and consistency across modules.

3️⃣ Streamlined employment lifecycle

From hire to rehire, from job changes to terminations, the end-to-end employment process is smoother, more automated, and more predictable.

4️⃣ Extensibility-first mindset

The new Extensibility Wizard on SAP BTP is now generally available, simplifying in-app and side-by-side extensions - a key step toward modular innovation.

5️⃣ Legacy cleanup continues

SAP continues to retire older frameworks, including the legacy People Profile, YouCalc workflows, classic accrual methods, and outdated SOAP APIs.

Let’s start with my favorite, the heart of the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite.

Employee Central

Employee Central (EC) continues to mature with emphasis on data visibility, permissions, and accuracy.

  • New History UI of Full Profile: History UI for Full Profile provides more streamlined experience when you manage previous, current, and future records of effective-dated entities.
  • Position Management: new validations and configuration consistency : 💪
    • Validation of Event Reason with Position Reclassification Follow-Up Process
    • Error Messages for Missing Employee Central Event Publishing Configuration Object
    • Enhancements in Right to Return Configuration
    • Enhanced Position Validation when Hiring an Employee with a Fixed-Term Contract
    • Position Job Requisition Processing Job Type Moved to Scheduled Job Manager
    • Moving Positions When Changing An Employee's Manager Assignment available for Promotion, Demotion and Transfer Quick Actions
    • Defaulting of the Manager or Position and Hierarchy Adaptation After Imports for Termination imports
  • Quick Actions : define ESS/MSS templates by country for common tasks.
  • Inactive Employment Access : employees can now view data from inactive employments.
  • Talent Data Transfer : move an individual’s talent data from inactive to active employment in one go.
  • Customizable Alert Notifications Using Document Generation : Document template per language and link it to the new Alert category group.
  • Improved HRIS Sync : detailed execution logs in Scheduled Job Manager.
  • Enhanced Permission Roles for Accessing Employee Data During Rehire: Define target populations for rehiring inactive employees on old or new employment through the Duplicate Check.
  • New Work Order Requires New Employment : Concurrent Employment for Contingent Workers renamed toNew Work Order Requires New Employment.
  • Workflow Enhancements in Latest People Profile.
  • API Enhancements : customString1 and lastDateWorked now filterable in OData APIs; character-based length validation introduced.

The overall tone is clear -- EC is being refined for reliability and audit-readiness.

Onboarding

Onboarding continues its evolution toward clarity and compliance stability.

  • Automate Onboarding Initiation from Recruiting.
  • A clear banner reminds administrators that Onboarding 1.0 reaches end of maintenance in 2H 2025 and deletion in 1H 2026.
  • New Onboarding Featured Cards on the Latest Home Page.
  • Mandatory Event Reason for Onboarding Process Initiation.
  • Employer signature rules renamed for easier configuration.
  • Error messaging during E-Verify and document upload is now explicit and contextual.
  • Enhancements to the U.S.C.I.S. Form I-9 💪
  • Automate National ID Information Extraction in Onboarding via SAP Document AI
    • SAP Document AI, embedded edition can extract the following information from the National ID :
      • Country/Region
      • National ID Card Type
      • National ID (Number)
      • Valid to
      • Valid from
  • Retaining New Hire Personal Information During Automatic Restart of Onboarding Process.

These refinements make the Onboarding experience far less error-prone and fully aligned with the new People Profile design.

Recruiting

Recruiting receives a language and layout overhaul for usability and consistency.

  • .Applicant Filtering by Assessment Score and Recommendation.
  • Simplified button labels such as Add Competencies, Close, Add to Talent Pool.
  • Browser tab titles and menu structures standardized across Job Requisition and Applicant Management pages.
  • Breadcrumb navigation added for candidates in the new Candidate Experience.
  • Automatic Transfer of Recruiting Skills to Growth Portfolio 💪
    • Only skill names are transferred to the Growth Portfolio. Proficiency levels must be updated manually.
  • Clearer menu grouping — Manage Requisition, Manage Job Postings, Manage Applicants.
  • Candidate Profile Extension in the Redesigned Applicant Management Tool
  • Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) using Identity Authentication Service (IAS) for Agency Users.

Small changes, yes — but they bring a big impact in how recruiters and candidates experience the hiring process. The real story, though, is what’s happening behind the scenes: SAP’s acquisition of SmartRecruiters.

This move signals a clear intent to strengthen SuccessFactors’ end-to-end recruiting capabilities, especially around AI-driven sourcing, CRM-style candidate nurturing, and intelligent matching. Over time, expect deeper integration between SmartRecruiters’ talent acquisition engine and SuccessFactors Recruiting 😉, blurring the lines between applicant tracking and experience management.

In short, it’s a quiet update with major strategic depth - and definitely one to keep a close eye on.

Learning

Learning continues its modernization path with focus on data integrity and AI-aligned skill handling.

  • Numeric-only validation for cost and hour fields in External Learning Requests.
  • Skill Standardization via SAP Business AI : supports both standardized and alternate skill names in the taxonomy.
  • Peer comments and Suggested By now visible on the Course Home.
  • Bulk Delete Unused iContent Files From Learning Administration 💪
  • Updated labels: View More → Show More, Register Employees → Finish Registration, Recommend → Submit.
  • Fix for multiple employments – same course now appears under each employment with relevant action buttons.

These changes improve both the learner experience and data alignment for AI-based recommendations.

Time Management & Tracking

Time Management becomes even more compliance-ready and automated.

  • Geofencing for Clock Time 💪

    • Only Google Maps is currently supported to render the maps shown in the application. If Google Maps isn't supported in your country/region, then you won't be able to use the Geofencing feature.
  • Automatic recalculation for changes in Holiday Calendars.
  • Yearly view in team absence calendar
  • Absences in weeks (especially for Australian compliance).
  • FMLA Dashboard integration with third-party providers in the U.S.
  • Deduction field now separate from “Requesting” for better clarity.
  • Permanent time accounts now replicable to SAP Payroll.

Each of these refinements increases transparency and reliability in time processing.

People Profile & Mobile Experience

The People Profile transformation continues at full speed.

  • New Editing UI and History UI for Full Profile.
  • Dependents, emergency contacts, and personal data UIs redesigned for accuracy.
  • Validation ensures one dependent can be linked to only one employee.
  • IsPrimary fields (contact, phone, email) become read-only once set.
  • Audit tracking now available for Full Profile category configurations.

Mobile updates:

  • Ability to switch between multiple active employments.
  • Save profile contacts directly to phone contacts.
  • Performance forms link to latest profile cards.
  • Enhanced proxy access security.

The user experience is now unified across desktop and mobile — a key prerequisite for AI-driven contextual insights.

Platform, Extensibility & Identity

Platform capabilities continue to expand quietly but significantly.

  • Job Profile Builder and Talent Intelligence Hub : Available by Default on New Tenants. 💪
  • MFA for critical transactions : optional multi-factor verification for sensitive actions.
  • Identity & Access Management (RBP) : collapsible search, cleaner labels, improved tooltips.
  • Instance Refresh Tool : new Check Quota option, reduced scheduling window to 3 months.
  • Public Links for Hosting Static Content : A new self-service capability -- upload static content and generate public links directly from a new tool in the Admin Center.
  • Extensibility Wizard on SAP BTP : enables in-app and side-by-side extensions.
  • Long-Time Login : Now users, with long-time login, users can remain logged in for up to 3 months without needing to re-authenticate.
  • People Analytics Product Name Is No Longer in Use : "Stories in People Analytics" is changed to "Story reports".

These backend improvements give administrators more control and transparency in managing large, multi-tenant environments.

Deprecations & End-of-Maintenance

Area Feature End of Maintenance & Deletion
TitleDescriptionEnd of MaintenanceDeletion
People ProfileLegacy Editing & History UINov 2027Nov 2027
Learning SearchDeprecation of Legacy Learning SearchNov 2025May 2027
WorkflowsXML-based (YouCalc) triggeringNov 2023May 2026
Time ManagementClassic accrual posting methodMay 2025Dec 2025
APIsSOAP-based EC APIs (except CompoundEmployee)May 2024Nov 2026
Pay ScalePicklist & APINov 2023Nov 2026
RehireRehire Inactive Employees pageMay 2025May 2026
People ProfileDeprecation of Data Viewing in Legacy People ProfileMay 2026May 2026

Action: Review these components before 2026.

Joule & GenAI Positioning

While this release is primarily functional, the AI foundation is unmistakable.

  • Strengthened data validations and consistent rule contexts ensure Joule consumes clean data.
  • Full Profile redesign supports contextual, skill-aware insights for AI assistants.
  • Extensibility Wizard simplifies integration of Joule skills and AI extensions.
  • Talent Intelligence Hub updates (timeline, proficiency visibility, “Not Rated” option) enhance semantic data for AI reasoning.
  • New transactional Joule use case — View Time Off Instructions (July 2025) — moves from navigation to transactional execution.

Final Take

If the 1H 2025 release was about launching Joule and introducing new AI ideas, 2H 2025 is about making the system ready for them.

UI modernization, better validation, and deprecation cleanup might not sound glamorous, but they decide how well your environment supports AI and analytics tomorrow.

  • Move fully to the latest People Profile.
  • Review and clean up inactive employment and dependent data.
  • Validate and update Quick Actions and workflows.
  • Plan for deprecations before 2026.
  • Start adopting the BTP Extensibility Wizard for future extensions.

2H 2025 is a foundation release — solid, stable, and designed to make your system Joule-ready by default.

Take time to explore these features in your preview environment, adjust configurations as needed, and collaborate with your recruiting teams to ensure a smooth rollout and optimal impact.

For full technical documentation, visit the SAP SuccessFactors What's New Viewer

For this release, I tried something different. Instead of writing separate blogs for each module, I focused on the most meaningful and interesting upgrades — the ones that actually matter. I’d love to hear what you think. Should I stick with this format or go back to module-wise blogs? If you enjoyed it, a kudo would mean a lot.

entry.title: How to Connect Your Personal GitHub to SAP Databricks
entry.content:
SAP Databricks is a powerful platform combining the best of SAP's enterprise data with Databricks' scalable analytics and AI capabilities. One of the first steps to becoming productive in this environment is integrating your personal GitHub account for version control and collaboration.

This blog walks you through the step-by-step process of linking your GitHub account to SAP Databricks, enabling seamless code management, branching, and collaboration.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • Access to an SAP Databricks workspace
  • A GitHub account (personal or organizational)
  • Appropriate permissions in Databricks (Workspace User or Admin)

Step-by-Step Guide

1. Link Your GitHub Account to Databricks

Databricks supports GitHub integration via OAuth or Personal Access Token (PAT). OAuth is recommended for personal accounts.

Using OAuth (Recommended):

  1. In Databricks, click your user icon → Settings
  2. Under Linked Accounts → Add Git Integration, click Link GitHub Account
  3. Authenticate via GitHub OAuth
  4. Approve the Databricks GitHub App installation

🔐OAuth tokens expire after 8 hours, but refresh tokens last 6 months. Re-authentication may be required after inactivity.

Using PAT (Alternative):

  1. Go to GitHub → Settings → Developer Settings → Personal Access Tokens
  2. Generate a token with scopes: repo, workflow
  3. Paste the token in Databricks under Git Integration

Create or Use a GitHub Repository

  • Go to GitHub and create a new repository (include a README for initial commit)
  • Copy the HTTPS URL of the repo

Add GitHub Repo to Databricks

  1. In Databricks, go to Repos (formerly Git folders)
  2. Click Create Repo
  3. Paste the GitHub URL and select the authentication method
  4. Click Create

⚠️If you see an error like “Error creating Git Folder,” ensure the Databricks GitHub App is installed for both your personal account and organization, and that repo access is set to All.

Work with Branches and Commits

  • Open your repo in Databricks
  • Click the branch name (e.g., main) to open the Git editor
  • Use Create Branch to start a dev branch
  • Make changes, add commit messages, and push to GitHub

Merging must be done in GitHub, not Databricks.

SAP Databricks is part of the SAP Business Data Cloud, and integrates deeply with SAP Datasphere and SAP AI Core. You can use GitHub-linked notebooks to:

  • Build ML models using SAP data
  • Track experiments with MLflow
  • Collaborate across SAP and non-SAP teams

For SAP admins, GitHub integration can also be configured at the account level using a machine user and PAT for automation and CI/CD pipelines.

 

Follow me for more updates - https://profile.sap.com/u/Yogananda

entry.title: Enhancing Flexible Workflows for Purchase Requisitions in SAP S/4HANA Based on Sum of All Line Items
entry.content:
Introduction
In today’s dynamic procurement environments, organizations need workflow mechanisms that intelligently adapt to business changes without adding unnecessary administrative overhead.
SAP S/4HANA’s Flexible Workflow framework provides this adaptability — but sometimes, additional logic is required to differentiate approval levels based on the extent of change in a Purchase Requisition (PR).

This blog post explains how to extend the standard Flexible Workflow to trigger different approval levels depending on total PR price or amount variation.
The approach uses custom tables, BAdI implementations, and ABAP classes to intelligently decide when a workflow should restart — either with single-level or multi-level approval. 

Business Requirement

The requirement is to handle changes to a Purchase Requisition (PR) that has already been released. Depending on how much the PR value changes (Total/Sum of all line items), the workflow should determine whether to restart as a single-step or multi-step approval process.

Scenario Price / Amount Change Approval Behavior

Minor Change0.01% – 5% or Amount ≤ 25,000Trigger Single-Level approval
Major Change≥ 5% or Amount > 25,000Trigger All Levels (Standard)

This design ensures minor updates don’t require multiple approvals, while significant changes trigger the full approval chain.

Solution Overview

To achieve this dynamic behavior, we implemented the following components:

  1. Custom Table (ZTPMM_PR_LOG) – Stores workflow flag conditions (X or N).
  2. Custom Class (ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS) – Determines PR change type using change logs (CDHDR, CDPOS).
  3. BAdI Implementation (MM_PUR_S4_PR_WFL_RESTART) – Evaluates restart logic for Flexible Workflow.
  4. Condition Evaluation Class (ZCL_IM_PMM_WF_CONDITION_IMP) – Validates workflow start conditions.

 

Workflow Flow Diagram

Below diagram shows the complete flow of logic — from PR creation/change through workflow triggering.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Custom Table – ZTPMM_PR_LOG

We created a custom transparent table ZTPMM_PR_LOG to store workflow type flags and PR numbers.
This table acts as a control mechanism for determining workflow behavior.

Table Fields

Field Key Data Element Description

MANDT✔MANDTClient
BANFN✔BANFNPurchase Requisition Number
WFTYP ZDE_PMM_WFTYPWorkflow Type (X = Single, N = Multi)

 

Determining Change Type – Class ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS

This class identifies change details from PR change logs (CDHDR, CDPOS) to determine whether a modification is significant.
It compares previous vs current values and calculates the percentage difference.
If the difference falls within or exceeds defined thresholds, it updates ZTPMM_PR_LOG accordingly.

*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Class Name:  ZCL_PMM_PR_REL_STATUS
* Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
* PR Approval Workflow - Get PR status single or Multi level flag
*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  METHOD get_pr_status.

    CONSTANTS :
      lc_objectclas     TYPE cdhdr-objectclas VALUE 'BANF',
      lc_tabname_eban   TYPE cdpos-tabname VALUE 'EBAN',
      lc_fname_frgzu    TYPE cdpos-fname VALUE 'FRGZU',
      lc_chngind_u      TYPE cdpos-chngind VALUE 'U'.


    TYPES: BEGIN OF lty_cdchange,
             mandant    TYPE cdpos-mandant,
             objectclas TYPE cdpos-objectclas,
             objectid   TYPE cdpos-objectid,
             changenr   TYPE cdpos-changenr,
             tabkey     TYPE cdpos-tabkey,
             fname      TYPE cdpos-fname,
             chngind    TYPE cdpos-chngind,
             value_old  TYPE cdpos-value_old,
             value_new  TYPE cdpos-value_new,
             username   TYPE cdhdr-username,
             udate      TYPE cdhdr-udate,
             utime      TYPE cdhdr-utime,
             tcode      TYPE cdhdr-tcode,
           END OF lty_cdchange.

    DATA: lt_cdpos     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF lty_cdchange,
          lt_cdhdr_top TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF cdhdr,
          lt_cdpos_raw TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF cdpos,
          lv_purchaser TYPE ebeln.

    " Step 1: Get last 2 entries from CDHDR
    SELECT * FROM cdhdr
      INTO TABLE _cdhdr_top
     WHERE objectclas = _objectclas
       AND objectid   = _ebeln 
     ORDER BY udate DESCENDING, utime DESCENDING
     .

    SORT lt_cdhdr_top BY udate DESCENDING utime DESCENDING.
    DELETE lt_cdhdr_top FROM 3.   " keep only the first 2 rows

    " Step 2: Get CDPOS entries that match CHANGENR from the above
    LOOP AT lt_cdhdr_top INTO DATA(ls_cdhdr).
      SELECT * FROM cdpos
        INTO TABLE lt_cdpos_raw                         "#EC CI_NOORDER
       WHERE objectclas = ls_cdhdr-objectclas
         AND objectid   = ls_cdhdr-objectid
         AND changenr   = ls_cdhdr-changenr
         AND tabname    = lc_tabname_eban
         AND fname      = lc_fname_frgzu
         AND chngind    = lc_chngind_u .

      LOOP AT lt_cdpos_raw INTO DATA(ls_pos).
        APPEND VALUE lty_cdchange(
          mandant     = ls_pos-mandant
          objectclas  = ls_pos-objectclas
          objectid    = ls_pos-objectid
          changenr    = ls_pos-changenr
          tabkey      = ls_pos-tabkey
          fname       = ls_pos-fname
          chngind     = ls_pos-chngind
          value_old   = ls_pos-value_old
          value_new   = ls_pos-value_new
          username    = ls_cdhdr-username
          udate       = ls_cdhdr-udate
          utime       = ls_cdhdr-utime
          tcode       = ls_cdhdr-tcode
        ) TO lt_cdpos.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.

**addional check for change case
    SELECT SINGLE *
      FROM ztpmm_pr_log
      INTO (ls_ztpmm_pr_log)
      WHERE banfn = _ebeln.

    """Validate the records
    READ TABLE lt_cdpos INTO DATA(ls_cfpos1) INDEX 1. "Latest record
    DELETE lt_cdpos WHERE tabkey NE ls_cfpos1-tabkey.     
    READ TABLE lt_cdpos INTO DATA(ls_cfpos2) INDEX 2. "Old record
    IF  ls_cfpos1-value_old IS NOT INITIAL AND ls_cfpos2-value_new IS NOT INITIAL
      AND ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp  = wc_x.
      ex_flag = wc_x. "single level
    ELSE.
      ex_flag = wc_n. "Multiple level
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

💡Tip: The same logic can be extended for other purchasing documents like Purchase Orders (POs).

Restart Logic – BAdI Implementation  

We used BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PR_WFL_RESTART to define the restart conditions for Flexible Workflow.
The following ABAP logic automatically determines if the workflow should restart as single-level (X) or multi-level (N).

(Notes :

  1. Variable lv_curr_total_value and lv_prev_total_value we need to sum all PR line items price from purchasereqitemscure and purchasereqitemsprev. We can create new static attribute table in class and fill information e.g. gt_purchasereqitemscurr and gt_purchasereqitemsprev  global table name
  2. Function module - ZFMPMM_RFC_PR_WF_ZUPD is remote enabled FM we update ztpmm_pr_log custom table from structure ls_ztpmm_pr_log )

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
"*  Custom Logic for Restarting Flexible Workflow for Purchase Requisition
"*  Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
"*  Description : Determines workflow restart logic based on price
"*                 or amount change thresholds (minor vs major)
"--------------------------------------------------------------------

CONSTANTS : 
  lc_x       TYPE wfl_restart VALUE  'X',
  lc_plus_5  TYPE p DECIMALS 2 VALUE '5',
  lc_plus_01 TYPE p DECIMALS 2 VALUE '0.01',           
  lc_rfc     TYPE rfcdest  VALUE 'NONE'.

DATA :
  lv_item_value       TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_prev_total_value TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_curr_total_value TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_diff             TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  lv_percent          TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log     TYPE ztpmm_pr_log, 
  lv_flag             TYPE abap_bool.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Calculate % difference between old and new PR values
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
lv_diff = lv_curr_total_value - lv_prev_total_value.
lv_percent = ( lv_diff / lv_prev_total_value ) * 100.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Check if difference exceeds thresholds (>5% or >25,000)
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_percent > lc_plus_5 OR lv_diff > 25000.        
  lv_flag = abap_true.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-banfn = purchasereqitemscurr-purchaserequisition.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp = wc_n. "Multiple level
ENDIF.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
" Check for minor changes (0.01%–4.99% or ≤25,000) → Single level
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_flag = abap_false AND
  ( ( lv_percent BETWEEN lc_plus_01 AND lc_plus_5 ) OR
    ( lv_diff BETWEEN lc_plus_01 AND 25000 ) ).
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-banfn = purchasereqitemscurr-purchaserequisition.
  ls_ztpmm_pr_log-wftyp = wc_x. "X = Single level
  lv_flag = abap_true.
ENDIF.

"-------------------------------------------------------------------- 
" Trigger restart if major change detected
"--------------------------------------------------------------------
IF lv_flag = abap_true.
  restartworkflow = lc_x.
  "Store WF indicator for PR: X = Single, N = Multiple
  CALL FUNCTION 'ZFMPMM_RFC_PR_WF_ZUPD' DESTINATION lc_rfc  
    EXPORTING
      im_ztpmm_pr_log = ls_ztpmm_pr_log.
ENDIF.

Logic Summary

Condition Workflow Type Approval Level

> 5% or > 25,000NMulti-Level
0.01%–4.99% or ≤ 25,000XSingle-Level

 

Workflow Start Condition – Fiori Configuration

We configured two Flexible Workflow variants in the Fiori app “Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions”, each linked to a specific start condition based on the ZTPMM_PR_LOG flag.

Single-Level Approval (Flag ‘X’)

Triggers a single-step approval when the Creation Indicator = ‘X’.

Multi-Level Approval (Flag ‘N’)

Triggers three sequential approvals (Procurement, Project Control, Budget Owner) when the Creation Indicator = ‘N’.

Conditional Evaluation – Dynamic Workflow Trigger

In the method IF_SWF_FLEX_IFS_CONDITION_EVAL~EVALUATE_CONDITION of class
ZCL_IM_PMM_WF_CONDITION_IMP, we dynamically evaluate workflow start parameters to determine if the condition should be true.

"--------------------------------------------------------------------
"  **Author : Shravankumar Tiwari
" Conditional Evaluation – Dynamic Workflow Trigger
"--------------------------------------------------------------------

METHOD if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_eval~evaluate_condition.
  LOOP AT it_parameter_value INTO ls_param_value.
    CASE ls_param_value-name.
      WHEN 'CreationIndicator'.
        READ TABLE lt_purchaserequisition INTO DATA(ls_purreq) INDEX 1.

        zcl_pmm_pr_rel_status=>get_pr_status(
          EXPORTING im_ebeln = ls_purreq-purchaserequisition
          IMPORTING ex_flag  = lv_flag_2
        ).

        IF ls_param_value-value EQ lv_flag_2.
          cv_is_true = abap_true.
        ELSE.
          cv_is_true = abap_false.
        ENDIF.

      WHEN OTHERS.
        cv_is_true = abap_false.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

Key Benefits

✅Efficiency – Avoid redundant approvals for minor PR changes
✅Scalability – Extendable to other workflow objects
✅Transparency – Logs stored in ZTPMM_PR_LOG
✅User-Friendly – Maintained via Fiori, no coding required

Conclusion:  This enhancement enables organizations to make their SAP S/4HANA Flexible Workflow truly adaptive and business-aware.
By combining custom ABAP logic, Fiori configuration, and workflow extensibility, we achieve a balanced approach to automation and control. 

Thank you for learning.

entry.title: SAP Databricks + Plotly : A Deadly Match for Analytics Excellence
entry.content:
In today’s data-driven world, businesses are constantly seeking ways to unlock deeper insights from their enterprise data. SAP, a leader in enterprise resource planning (ERP) S/4 HANA Private Cloud, Public Cloud..etc, holds vast amounts of structured business data. Databricks, a unified data analytics platform, excels at processing and analyzing large-scale data. Plotly, a powerful visualization library, brings those insights to life with interactive dashboards.

Together, these SAP Databricks and Plotly form a deadly match—not in destruction, but in delivering killer analytics.

Samples

Github - Notebook

Get Started

Go to your Workspace - Right Corner Click Create and Select Notebook ( you can use Git repo or use the above link)

Install the required Python libraries to get working on your analytics Model

Why This Trio Works So Well

  • SAP: The source of truth for business operations—finance, supply chain, HR, and more.
  • SAP Databricks: The engine that transforms raw SAP data into usable insights using Apache Spark and Delta Lake.
  • Plotly: The artist that paints the picture, turning numbers into interactive, decision-ready visuals.

Example 1: Supply Chain Optimization

Scenario: A company wants to analyze delivery delays across regions.

  1. SAP: Extract delivery logs and order data using SAP Data Intelligence or OData services.
  2. Databricks: Clean and join datasets, apply machine learning to predict delays.
  3. Plotly: Visualize delay trends by region, product category, and carrier.
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd

# Sample data
df = pd.DataFrame({
    "Region": ["North", "South", "East", "West"],
    "Avg_Delay_Days": [2.5, 3.1, 1.8, 4.0]
})

fig = px.bar(df, x="Region", y="Avg_Delay_Days", title="Average Delivery Delay by Region")
fig.show()

Example 2: Financial Forecasting

Scenario: CFO wants to forecast quarterly revenue using historical SAP financial data.

  1. SAP: Pull GL and revenue data.
  2. Databricks: Apply time series forecasting models (e.g., Prophet).
  3. Plotly: Display forecast vs. actuals with confidence intervals.
import plotly.graph_objects as go

# Sample forecast data
quarters = ["Q1", "Q2", "Q3", "Q4"]
actuals = [100, 120, 130, 150]
forecast = [105, 125, 135, 160]

fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=quarters, y=actuals, mode='lines+markers', name='Actual'))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=quarters, y=forecast, mode='lines+markers', name='Forecast'))

fig.update_layout(title="Quarterly Revenue Forecast", xaxis_title="Quarter", yaxis_title="Revenue (in M€)")
fig.show()

Now it's your turn to innovate—unlock the full potential of your data, drive smarter decisions, and shape the future of your enterprise.

The tools are in your hands—go build something extraordinary!

To build on your stack A Hint:

  • Use SAP Data Intelligence or SAP BW connectors to extract data.
  • Load into Databricks Delta Lake for scalable processing.
  • Use Plotly Dash or Plotly Express for visualization in notebooks or web apps.

Conclusion

The combination of SAP, Databricks, and Plotly empowers organizations to go from raw data to actionable insights—fast. Whether you're optimizing operations, forecasting finances, or understanding your workforce, this trio delivers clarity, speed, and impact.

 

Follow me for more updates - https://profile.sap.com/u/Yogananda

entry.title: Re: In ABAP Unit, failing to get the number of available workprocesses for pRFC
entry.content:
The question is only about pRFC.  SPBT_INITIALIZE and SPBT_GET_CURR_RESOURCE_INFO work perfectly together.

Thanks for the aRFC information. In my system with one application server, I obtain the same number of available workprocesses (and maximum WP) in both SPBT_INITIALIZE/SPBT_GET_CURR_RESOURCE_INFO and in TH_ARFC_LOCAL_RESOURCES.

But that would be different if the system had several application servers. I did a test on a system with two application servers, TH_ARFC_LOCAL_RESOURCES returns data for the current application server only, while the two SPBT function modules return data for all servers or the ones of the requested group server.

Of course, in my context (ABAP Unit), it's quite rare in customer systems to have a development system with several application servers. With one application server the function modules for aRFC and pRFC give the same result.

3669497 - Message No. /PLMU/UI_FRW009 is raised within EAM Web Dynpro Apps - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Enable company domain id in Email notification trigge...
entry.content:
Hi Mumtaz,

When you enable SuccessFactors to use your company domain instead of the default "system@successfactors.com" , all emails from SuccessFactors will be sent by the given domain. So the users will see the emails coming from the company domain and not from the default.

Also sometimes company firewall settings can see the standard sender as "spam", so implementing this can also help in that regard.

This feature is called single sender, and you read more about it in KBA 2087739 - Single Sender and Single Recipient | How They Work and Setting Them Up in SuccessFactors

Kind Regards,

Peter

SAP Support
